casebody.data:
Adrian GOUGH, Appellant,
v.
ST. LOUIS METROPOLITAN POLICE DEPARTMENT, et al., Respondents. No. ED 107169 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. FILED: July 30, 2019 FOR APPELLANT, Matthew A. Radefeld, 7710 Carondelet, Suite 350, Clayton, MO 63105. For Respondent, ERIC S. SCHMITT, Richard N. Groeneman, P.O. Box 861, St. Louis, MO 63188. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Adrian Gough ("Appellant") appeals from the trial court's order and judgment granting the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department's ("Respondent") motion to dismiss and denying his Petition for Expungement of Arrest Records pursuant to Section 610.122, RSMo. We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
